result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jorge Marchan

defendant.name: Marchan, Jorge
defendant.address: 7725 West Lincoln Avenue, West Allis, WI 53219

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jorge Marchan in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Jorge Marchan.  
Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy not in court. 

Case in court for a Scheduling Conference. Ada Murphy is in a different court and unavailable at time of hearing .  
Defense requests motion hearing date.  Defense motions due by 10-7-2022.,  State's reply due by 11-7-2022  Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Ada Murphy Confirmed Motion Hearing via email.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jorge Marchan in court with Attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 07-19-2022

Defendant Jorge Marchan in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Patrick Dennis Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Status Conference.  Attorney Michael B. Plaisted accepted Appointment of Counsel.  Defense has not received Discovery.  Case scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense

Defendant Jorge Marchan in court.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for State Public Defender appointment. Court finds defendant qualifies for Court appointed attorney. Attorney Michael Plaisted to be appointed at County expense, Defendant ordered to reimburse the county at $50 per month. Case is adjourned in Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD.

Defendant Jorge Marchan in court, appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
Scram bracelet and Breathalyzer Tests Ordered to monitor defendant maintains absolute sobriety.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Jorge Marchan in court with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/18/2022@2:30pm
